section.title: Settings
section.paragraph: This is the list of (non-toggle) Django settings defined in the common.py modules of edx-platform.

note.paragraph: Toggle settings, which enable or disable a specific feature, are documented in the feature toggles section.

section.title: ACCOUNT_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the micro-frontend-based account settings page.

warning.paragraph: Also set site’s ENABLE_ACCOUNT_MICROFRONTEND and account.redirect_to_microfrontend waffle flag

section.title: BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS
section.paragraph: Stores all the settings used by block structures and block structure related tasks. See BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS[XXX] documentation for details of each setting. For more information, check https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/13388.

section.title: BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS[‘COURSE_PUBLISH_TASK_DELAY’]
section.paragraph: Delay, in seconds, after a new edit of a course is published before updating the block structures cache. This is needed for a better chance at getting the latest changes when there are secondary reads in sharded mongoDB clusters. For more information, check https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/13388 and https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/14571.

section.title: BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS[‘TASK_DEFAULT_RETRY_DELAY’]
section.paragraph: Delay, in seconds, between retry attempts if a block structure task fails. For more information, check https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/13388 and https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/14571.

section.title: BLOCK_STRUCTURES_SETTINGS[‘TASK_MAX_RETRIES’]
section.paragraph: Maximum number of retries per block structure task. If the maximum number of retries is exceeded, then you can attempt to either manually run the celery task, or wait for it to be triggered again. For more information, check https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/13388 and https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/pull/14571.

section.title: CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_CONNECT_TIMEOUT
section.paragraph: Set the number of seconds LMS will wait to establish an internal connection to the codejail remote service.

section.title: CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_HOST
section.paragraph: Set the codejail remote service host

section.title: CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_READ_TIMEOUT
section.paragraph: Set the number of seconds LMS/CMS will wait for a response from the codejail remote service endpoint.

section.title: CODE_JAIL_REST_SERVICE_REMOTE_EXEC
section.paragraph: Set the python package.module.function that is reponsible of calling the remote service in charge of jailed code execution

section.title: COMPREHENSIVE_THEME_DIRS
section.paragraph: A list of paths to directories, each of which will be searched for comprehensive themes. Do not override this Django setting directly. Instead, set the COMPREHENSIVE_THEME_DIRS environment variable, using colons (:) to separate paths.

section.title: COMPREHENSIVE_THEME_LOCALE_PATHS
section.paragraph: A list of the paths to themes locale directories e.g. “COMPREHENSIVE_THEME_LOCALE_PATHS” : [“/edx/src/edx-themes/conf/locale”].

section.title: CUSTOM_RESOURCE_TEMPLATES_DIRECTORY
section.paragraph: Path to an existing directory of YAML files containing html content to be used with the subclasses of xmodule.x_module.ResourceTemplates. Default example templates can be found in xmodule/templates/html. Note that the extension used is “.yaml” and not “.yml”. See xmodule.x_module.ResourceTemplates for usage. “CUSTOM_RESOURCE_TEMPLATES_DIRECTORY” : null

section.title: DEFAULT_SITE_THEME
section.paragraph: Theme to use when no site or site theme is defined, for example “dark-theme”. Set to None if you want to use openedx default theme.

warning.paragraph: The theme folder needs to be in ‘edx-platform/themes’ or define the path to the theme folder in COMPREHENSIVE_THEME_DIRS. To be effective, ENABLE_COMPREHENSIVE_THEMING has to be enabled.

section.title: DISCUSSIONS_MFE_FEEDBACK_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the discussions micro-frontend google form based feedback.

section.title: DISCUSSIONS_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the micro-frontend-based discussions page.

warning.paragraph: Also set site’s courseware.discussions_mfe waffle flag.

section.title: LEARNING_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the micro-frontend-based courseware page.

section.title: LOGIN_REDIRECT_WHITELIST
section.paragraph: While logout, if logout request has a redirect-url as query strings, then the redirect-url is validated through LOGIN_REDIRECT_WHITELIST.

section.title: MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS_ALLOWED
section.paragraph: Specifies the maximum failed login attempts allowed to users. Once the user reaches this failure threshold then the account will be locked for a configurable amount of seconds (30 minutes) which will prevent additional login attempts until this time period has passed. This setting is related with MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS_LOCKOUT_PERIOD_SECS and only used when ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS is enabled.

section.title: MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS_LOCKOUT_PERIOD_SECS
section.paragraph: Specifies the lockout period in seconds for consecutive failed login attempts. Once the user reaches the threshold of the login failure, then the account will be locked for the given amount of seconds (30 minutes) which will prevent additional login attempts until this time period has passed. This setting is related with MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS_ALLOWED and only used when ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS is enabled.

section.title: PARENTAL_CONSENT_AGE_LIMIT
section.paragraph: The age at which a learner no longer requires parental consent, or ``None`` if parental consent is never required.

section.title: PLATFORM_NAME
section.paragraph: The display name of the platform to be used in templates/emails/etc.

section.title: PREPEND_LOCALE_PATHS
section.paragraph: A list of the paths to locale directories to load first e.g. “PREPEND_LOCALE_PATHS” : [“/edx/my-locales/”].

section.title: REGISTRATION_EMAIL_PATTERNS_ALLOWED
section.paragraph: Optional setting to restrict registration / account creation to only emails that match a regex in this list. Set to ``None`` to allow any email (default).

section.title: REGISTRATION_RATELIMIT
section.paragraph: New users are registered on edx via RegistrationView. It’s POST end-point is rate-limited up to 60 requests per IP Address in a week by default. Purpose of this setting is to restrict an attacker from registering numerous fake accounts.

section.title: REGISTRATION_VALIDATION_RATELIMIT
section.paragraph: Whenever a user tries to register on edx, the data entered during registration is validated via RegistrationValidationView. It’s POST endpoint is rate-limited up to 30 requests per IP Address in a week by default. It was introduced because an attacker can guess or brute force a series of names to enumerate valid users.

section.title: RETIRED_EMAIL_DOMAIN
section.paragraph: Set the domain part of hashed emails for retired users. Used by the derived setting RETIRED_EMAIL_FMT.

section.title: RETIRED_EMAIL_FMT
section.paragraph: Set the format a retired user email field gets transformed into, where {} is replaced with the hash of the original email. This is a derived setting that depends on RETIRED_EMAIL_PREFIX and RETIRED_EMAIL_DOMAIN values.

section.title: RETIRED_EMAIL_PREFIX
section.paragraph: Set the prefix part of hashed emails for retired users. Used by the derived setting RETIRED_EMAIL_FMT.

section.title: RETIRED_USERNAME_FMT
RETIRED_USERNAME_PREFIX
section.paragraph: Set the prefix part of hashed usernames for retired users. Used by the derived setting RETIRED_USERNAME_FMT.

section.title: RETIRED_USER_SALTS
section.paragraph: Set a list of salts used for hashing usernames and emails on users retirement.

warning.paragraph: Only the last item in this list is used as a salt for all new retirements, but historical salts are preserved in order to guarantee that all hashed usernames and emails can still be checked.

section.title: RETIREMENT_SERVICE_WORKER_USERNAME
section.paragraph: Set the username of the retirement service worker user. Retirement scripts authenticate with LMS as this user with oauth client credentials.

section.title: RETIREMENT_STATES
section.paragraph: Set a list that defines the name and order of states for the retirement workflow.

warning.paragraph: These states are stored in the database and it is the responsibility of the administrator to populate the state list since the states can vary across different installations. There must be, at minimum, a PENDING state at the beginning, and COMPLETED, ERRORED, and ABORTED states at the end of the list.

section.title: STATIC_URL_BASE
section.paragraph: The LMS and CMS use this to construct ``STATIC_URL`` by appending a slash (if needed), and for the CMS, ``studio/`` afterwards.

section.title: XBLOCK_EXTRA_MIXINS
section.paragraph: Custom mixins that will be dynamically added to every XBlock and XBlockAside instance. These can be classes or dotted-path references to classes. For example: `XBLOCK_EXTRA_MIXINS = (‘my_custom_package.my_module.MyCustomMixin’,)`

section.title: XBLOCK_FIELD_DATA_WRAPPERS
section.paragraph: Paths to wrapper methods which should be applied to every XBlock’s FieldData.

section.title: XBLOCK_RUNTIME_V2_EPHEMERAL_DATA_CACHE
section.paragraph: The django cache key of the cache to use for storing anonymous user state for XBlocks.

section.title: XBLOCK_SETTINGS
section.paragraph: Dictionary containing server-wide configuration of XBlocks on a per-type basis. By default, keys should match the XBlock `block_settings_key` attribute/property. If the attribute/property is not defined, use the XBlock class name. Check `xmodule.services.SettingsService` for more reference.

section.title: CATALOG_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the micro-frontend-based course catalog page.

section.title: CCX_MAX_STUDENTS_ALLOWED
section.paragraph: Maximum number of students allowed in a CCX (Custom Courses for edX), This is an arbitrary hard limit, chosen so that a CCX does not compete with public MOOCs.

section.title: CELERY_EXTRA_IMPORTS
section.paragraph: Adds extra packages that don’t get auto-imported (Example: XBlocks). These packages are added in addition to those added by CELERY_IMPORTS.

section.title: CONTENT_FOR_SPAM_POSTS
section.paragraph: Content to replace spam posts with

section.title: COURSE_MEMBER_API_ENROLLMENT_LIMIT
section.paragraph: This limits the response size of the `get_course_members` API, throwing an exception if the number of Enrolled users is greater than this number. This is needed to limit the dataset size since the API does most of the calculation in Python to avoid expensive database queries.

section.title: DISABLED_ORGS_FOR_PROGRAM_NUDGE
section.paragraph: List of organization codes that should be disabled

section.title: DISCUSSION_SPAM_URLS
section.paragraph: Urls to filter from discussion content to avoid spam

section.title: EDXNOTES_CLIENT_NAME
section.paragraph: Set the name of the Oauth client used by LMS to authenticate with the edx_notes_api service.

warning.paragraph: The Oauth client must be created in the platform Django admin in the path /admin/oauth2_provider/application/, setting the name field of the client as the value of this setting.

section.title: EDXNOTES_CONNECT_TIMEOUT
section.paragraph: Set the number of seconds LMS will wait to establish an internal connection to the edx_notes_api service.

section.title: EDXNOTES_INTERNAL_API
section.paragraph: Set the internal API endpoint LMS will use in the backend to interact with the edx_notes_api service.

warning.paragraph: Normally set to the same value of EDXNOTES_PUBLIC_API. It is not mandatory for this setting to be a publicly accessible endpoint, but to be accessible by the LMS service. It is only used when the setting settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES is activated.

section.title: EDXNOTES_PUBLIC_API
section.paragraph: Set the public API endpoint LMS will use in the frontend to interact with the edx_notes_api service.

warning.paragraph: This setting must be a publicly accessible endpoint. It is only used when the setting settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES is activated.

section.title: EDXNOTES_READ_TIMEOUT
section.paragraph: Set the number of seconds LMS will wait for a response from the edx_notes_api service internal endpoint.

section.title: ELASTIC_SEARCH_INDEX_PREFIX
section.paragraph: Specifies the prefix used when naming elasticsearch indexes related to edx-search.

section.title: EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG
section.paragraph: Dictionary of event_types mapped to dictionaries of topic to topic-related configuration. Each topic configuration dictionary contains * `enabled`: a toggle denoting whether the event will be published to the topic. These should be annotated according to https://docs.openedx.org/projects/edx-toggles/en/latest/how_to/documenting_new_feature_toggles.html * `event_key_field` which is a period-delimited string path to event data field to use as event key. Note: The topic names should not include environment prefix as it will be dynamically added based on EVENT_BUS_TOPIC_PREFIX setting.

section.title: EXAMS_DASHBOARD_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the exams dashboard micro-frontend for instructors.

section.title: GRADEBOOK_FREEZE_DAYS
section.paragraph: Sets the number of days after which the gradebook will freeze following the course’s end.

section.title: HIBP_LOGIN_BLOCK_PASSWORD_FREQUENCY_THRESHOLD
section.paragraph: Log10 threshold in effect for ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY. See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.

section.title: HIBP_LOGIN_NUDGE_PASSWORD_FREQUENCY_THRESHOLD
section.paragraph: Log10 threshold in effect for ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY. See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.

section.title: HIBP_REGISTRATION_PASSWORD_FREQUENCY_THRESHOLD
section.paragraph: Log10 threshold in effect for ENABLE_AUTHN_REGISTER_HIBP_POLICY. See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.

section.title: LTI_CUSTOM_PARAMS
section.paragraph: This expands the list of optional LTI parameters that the platform accepts. These parameters are not used by the platform, but can then be used by other plugins.

section.title: MAINTENANCE_BANNER_TEXT
section.paragraph: Specifies the text that is rendered on the maintenance banner.

warning.paragraph: Depends on the `open_edx_util.display_maintenance_warning` waffle switch. The banner is only rendered when the switch is activated.

section.title: MFE_CONFIG
section.paragraph: Is a configuration that will be exposed by the MFE Config API to be consumed by the MFEs. Contains configuration common to all MFEs. When a specific MFE’s configuration is requested, these values will be treated as a base and then overriden/supplemented by those in `MFE_CONFIG_OVERRIDES`. Example: { “BASE_URL”: “https://name_of_mfe.example.com”, “LANGUAGE_PREFERENCE_COOKIE_NAME”: “example-language-preference”, “CREDENTIALS_BASE_URL”: “https://credentials.example.com”, “DISCOVERY_API_BASE_URL”: “https://discovery.example.com”, “LMS_BASE_URL”: “https://courses.example.com”, “LOGIN_URL”: “https://courses.example.com/login”, “LOGOUT_URL”: “https://courses.example.com/logout”, “STUDIO_BASE_URL”: “https://studio.example.com”, “LOGO_URL”: “https://courses.example.com/logo.png” }

section.title: MFE_CONFIG_API_CACHE_TIMEOUT
section.paragraph: The MFE Config API response will be cached during the specified time

section.title: MFE_CONFIG_OVERRIDES
ORA_GRADING_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the micro-frontend-based openassessment grading page. This is will be show in the open response tab list data.

section.title: ORA_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL for modern openassessment app. This is will be show in the open response tab list data.

warning.paragraph: Also set site’s openresponseassessment.mfe_views waffle flag.

section.title: ORA_PEER_LEASE_EXPIRATION_HOURS
section.paragraph: Amount of time before a lease on a peer submission expires

section.title: ORA_STAFF_LEASE_EXPIRATION_HOURS
section.paragraph: Amount of time before a lease on a staff submission expires

section.title: PROFILE_INFORMATION_REPORT_PRIVATE_FIELDS
section.paragraph: List of private fields that will be hidden from the profile information report.

section.title: PROFILE_MICROFRONTEND_URL
section.paragraph: Base URL of the micro-frontend-based profile page.

warning.paragraph: Also set site’s ENABLE_PROFILE_MICROFRONTEND and learner_profile.redirect_to_microfrontend waffle flag

section.title: PYTHON_LIB_FILENAME
section.paragraph: Name of the course file to make available to code in custom Python-graded problems. By default, this file will not be downloadable by learners.

section.title: RATELIMIT_RATE
section.paragraph: Due to some reports about attack on /oauth2/access_token/ which took LMS down, this setting was introduced to rate-limit all endpoints of AccessTokenView up to 120 requests per IP Address in a minute by default.

warning.paragraph: RATELIMIT_ENABLE flag must also be enabled/set to True to use this RATELIMIT_RATE setting.

section.title: RECAPTCHA_PRIVATE_KEY
section.paragraph: Add recaptcha private key to use captcha feature in discussion app.

section.title: RECAPTCHA_PROJECT_ID
section.paragraph: Add recaptcha project id to use captcha feature in discussion app.

warning.paragraph: This setting is used to configure the reCAPTCHA project ID for the discussion app. The project ID is used to identify the reCAPTCHA project in the Google Cloud Console and is required for the reCAPTCHA service to function correctly. The project ID should be obtained from the Google Cloud Console when creating a reCAPTCHA

section.title: RECAPTCHA_SITE_KEYS
section.paragraph: Add recaptcha site keys to use captcha feature in discussion app.

warning.paragraph: This setting is used to configure the reCAPTCHA keys for web, iOS, and Android platforms. The keys are expected to be in the format: { ‘web’: ‘your-web-site-key’, ‘ios’: ‘your-ios-site-key’, ‘android’: ‘your-android-site-key’, }

section.title: REGISTRATION_EXTRA_FIELDS
section.paragraph: The signup form may contain extra fields that are presented to every user. For every field, we can specifiy whether it should be “required”: to display the field, and make it mandatory; “optional”: to display the optional field as part of a toggled input field list; “optional-exposed”: to display the optional fields among the required fields, and make it non-mandatory; “hidden”: to not display the field. When the terms of service are not visible and agreement to the honor code is required (the default), the signup page includes a paragraph that links to the honor code page (defined my MKTG_URLS[“HONOR”]). This page might not be available for all Open edX platforms. In such cases, the “honor_code” registration field should be “hidden”.

section.title: SECURITY_PAGE_URL
section.paragraph: A link to the site’s security disclosure/reporting policy, to display in the site footer. This will only appear for sites using themes that use the links produced by ``lms.djangoapps.branding.api.get_footer``.

section.title: SURVEY_REPORT_CHECK_THRESHOLD
section.paragraph: Survey report banner will appear if a survey report is not sent in the months defined.

section.title: SURVEY_REPORT_ENDPOINT
section.paragraph: Endpoint where the report will be sent.

section.title: SURVEY_REPORT_EXTRA_DATA
section.paragraph: Dictionary with additional information that you want to share in the report.

section.title: DEFAULT_GRADE_DESIGNATIONS
section.paragraph: The default ‘pass’ grade cutoff designations to be used. The failure grade is always ‘F’ and should not be included in this list.

warning.paragraph: The DEFAULT_GRADE_DESIGNATIONS list must have more than one designation, or else [‘A’, ‘B’, ‘C’, ‘D’] will be used as the default grade designations. Also, only the first 11 grade designations are used by the UI, so it’s advisable to restrict the list to 11 items.

section.title: DEFAULT_ORG_LOGO_URL
section.paragraph: The default logo url for organizations that do not have a logo set.

warning.paragraph: This url is used as a placeholder for organizations that do not have a logo set.

section.title: EVENT_BUS_PRODUCER_CONFIG
section.paragraph: Dictionary of event_types mapped to dictionaries of topic to topic-related configuration. Each topic configuration dictionary contains * `enabled`: a toggle denoting whether the event will be published to the topic. These should be annotated according to https://docs.openedx.org/projects/edx-toggles/en/latest/how_to/documenting_new_feature_toggles.html * `event_key_field` which is a period-delimited string path to event data field to use as event key. Note: The topic names should not include environment prefix as it will be dynamically added based on EVENT_BUS_TOPIC_PREFIX setting.

section.title: GIT_EXPORT_DEFAULT_IDENT
section.paragraph: When courses are exported to git, commits are signed with this name/email git identity.

section.title: GIT_REPO_EXPORT_DIR
section.paragraph: When courses are exported to git, either with the export_git management command or the git export view from the studio (when settings.ENABLE_EXPORT_GIT is True), they are stored in this directory, which must exist at the time of the export.

section.title: LIBRARY_ENABLED_BLOCKS
section.paragraph: List of block types that are ready/enabled to be created/used

section.title: STUDIO_NAME
section.paragraph: The name that will appear on the landing page of Studio, as well as in various emails and templates.
